    • Method Detail

      • cancelAllActiveRequests

        public void cancelAllActiveRequests()
        Description copied from interface: INetworkClient
        Cancels all active requests this client has running. Note that this doesn't necessarily stop any underlying sending of data through the network. The only guarantee is that no response listeners will be called. Implementation note: unfortunately, GRPC stream requests provide no way to cancel them, so these are not currently cancelled.
        Specified by:
        cancelAllActiveRequests in interface INetworkClient

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Description copied from interface: INetworkClient
        Shuts down this INetworkClient. All active requests are cancelled, and the underlying channel is shutdown cleanly (requests in progress will finish, but no new ones will be accepted). Note that any streaming requests may continue indefinitely.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface INetworkClient

      • shutdownNow

        public void shutdownNow()
        Description copied from interface: INetworkClient
        Shuts down this INetworkClient immediately, forcefully closing even preexisting calls. This is the preferred method to call when using INetworkClient from an Android activity or service that is finishing, because it should guarantee that no further callbacks will be invoked.
        Specified by:
        shutdownNow in interface INetworkClient
